• Foxes have a long pointed snout with triangular-shaped ears, which stick up and a long bushy tail.

• The red fox is the most commonly found and widespread fox in the world.

• The red foxes fur colour can vary from red to a dull red to a deep brownish-red, sometimes with yellow tints.  The coat under the red foxes chin, around its lower lips and throat and down the front of its chest is almost always white.

• The red foxes tail is long and bushy and it is nearly always as long or longer than half the length of the fox's body.

• The tail usually has a pale grey underside which ends in a pointed white tip.  The red fox will often wrap its tail around its body and curl up into a ball to keep warm in cold weather.

• The fox uses its tail to keep its balance when running or jumping.

• Male foxes are called Dogs, Reynard or Tod.

• Female foxes are called Vixens.  Young foxes are called Kits, Cubs or Pups.

• Groups of foxes are known as a Skulk or a Leash.

• Breathnaíonn sionnach dearg cosúil le madra beag go meánmhéide.  Faigheann sé a n-ainm ó dhath a bhfionnadh.

• Tá smut fada pointeáilte ag sionnaigh le cluasa triantánacha-chruthach, a chloíonn suas agus eireaball fada dosach.

• Is é an sionnach dearg an sionnach is coitianta a fhaightear agus is forleithne ar domhan.

• Is féidir le dath fionnaidh na sionnach dearg a bheith éagsúil ó dhearg go dearg dorcha go donn-dearg, uaireanta le himir buí.  Tá an cóta faoi smig na sionnach dearg, timpeall a liopaí agus a scornach agus síos os comhair a bhrollach bíonn sé beagnach bán i gcónaí.

• Tá eireaball na sionnach dearg fada agus dosach agus tá sé beagnach i gcónaí chomh fada nó níos faide ná leath fad choirp an tsionnaigh.

• De ghnáth bíonn taobh liathéadrom ag an eireaball a chríochnaíonn i rinn bhán pointeáilte.  Is minic a fhillfidh an sionnach dearg a eireaball timpeall a choirp agus cuirfidh sé suas i liathróid é chun teas a choinneáil in aimsir fhuar.

• Úsáideann an sionnach a eireaball chun a chothromaíocht a choinneáil agus é ag rith nó ag léim.

• Tugtar Madraí, Reynard nó Tod ar sionnaigh fireanna.

• Tugtar Vixens ar sionnaigh baineanna.  Tugtar Kits, Cubs nó Pups ar sionnaigh óga.

• Tugtar Skulk nó Leash ar ghrúpaí sionnach.

• Red foxes homes are called dens.

• Foxes make their dens by digging burrows into the ground.  This provides the fox and its family with a safe place to stay, rest and sleep and to look after their cubs.

• Burrows can be very deep.  Dens have several rooms and nearly always more than one entrance and exit so, if predators come into the den, the fox and his family can escape.

• Sometimes a fox will share a badger's home with the badger.  Badgers homes are called Setts.

• Tugtar pluais ar thithe sionnaigh dhearga.

• Déanann sionnaigh a gcuid pluais trí pholl a thochailt isteach sa talamh.  Soláthraíonn sé seo áit shábháilte don sionnach agus dá theaghlach chun fanacht, scíth agus codladh agus aire a thabhairt dá gcoileáin.

• Is féidir le poill a bheith an-domhain.  Tá roinnt seomraí ag pluaiseanna agus bíonn  beagnach i gcónaí níos mó ná bealach isteach agus bealach amach amháin mar sin, má thagann creachadóirí isteach sa nead, is féidir leis an sionnach agus a theaghlach éalú.

• Uaireanta roinnfidh sionnach brocais leis an mbroc.  Tugtar Brocach ar bhrocais.

• Red foxes live in family groups.

• The groups tend to be small and are almost always led by a pair of senior foxes.

• Fox cubs are tiny when they are born and they are also blind and deaf and have no teeth.  They are completely defenceless.  The female fox or Vixen looks after and protects them until they are ready to leave.

• The male fox, or the dog, stays near the family home to watch over the cubs and the Vixen and brings the Vixen food when she is looking after their cubs.

• The main enemy of the fox is Man.  Wolves, coyotes, hyenas, grey foxes, jackals, medium and large cats such as cougars, lynxes, bobcats and wildcat will attack foxes.

• Tá sionnaigh dhearga ina gcónaí i ngrúpaí teaghlaigh.

• Is gnách go mbíonn na grúpaí beag agus bíonn péire sionnach sinsearach i gcónaí i gceannas orthu.

• Tá coileáin an tsionnaigh beag bídeach nuair a bheirtear iad agus tá siad dall agus bodhar agus níl aon fhiacla acu.  Tá siad go hiomlán gan chosaint.  Tugann an sionnach baineann aire dóibh agus cosnaíonn sí iad go dtí go mbeidh siad réidh le himeacht.

• Fanann an sionnach fireann, nó an madra, in aice le teach an teaghlaigh chun féachaint ar na coileáin agus an sionnach baineann agus tugann sé bia don shionnach baineann nuair a bhíonn sí ag tabhairt aire dá gcoileáin.

• Is é an duine daonna príomh-namhaid an tsionnaigh.  Déanfaidh mic tíre, cadhóití, hiéanaí, sionnaigh liatha, seacainí, cait mheánacha agus mhóra mar cúgarí, lincsí, bobchait agus cait fháin ionsaí ar sionnaigh.

• The Red Fox inhabits almost everywhere that man has settled and can nearly always be found living not too far away from those settlements.

• Red foxes are found all over the world. They inhabit the entire northern hemisphere from the Arctic Circle down through North America and into North Africa and Central America.  Red foxes dwell throughout Asia and Australia.

• The Red Fox is the most widespread wild dog throughout the world and is also the largest of all the true foxes.

• Tá an Sionnach Dearg ina chónaí beagnach i ngach áit a bhfuil daoine socraithe agus is féidir é a fháil beagnach i gcónaí ag maireachtáil  in áit nach bhfuil ró-fhada ó na lonnaíochtaí sin.

• Tá sionnaigh dhearga le fáil ar fud an domhain. Áitríonn siad an leathsféar thuaidh ar fad ón gCiorcal Artach síos trí Mheiriceá Thuaidh agus isteach san Afraic Thuaidh agus i Meiriceá Láir.  Tá sionnaigh dhearga ina gcónaí ar fud na hÁise agus na hAstráile.

• Is é an Sionnach Dearg an madra fiáin is forleithne ar fud an domhain agus is é an ceann is mó de na sionnaigh fíor go léir é freisin.

• The fox is a member of the dog family.

• Strangely, many of its habits and how the fox moves and acts are cat-like.

• Foxes are very stealthy like cats and they hunt their prey in the same way, carefully sneaking up then pouncing on it.

• Red foxes are excellent swimmers and have excellent hearing and a fantastic sense of smell.

• Is ball de theaghlach an mhadra é an sionnach.

• Go haisteach, tá go leor dá nósanna agus an chaoi a bhogann agus a ghníonn an sionnach cosúil le cat.

• Tá sionnaigh an-fháilí cosúil le cait agus bíonn siad ag seilg a gcreiche ar an mbealach céanna, éalú go cúramach suas ansin pag léim air.

• Is snámhaithe den scoth iad sionnaigh dhearga agus tá éisteacht den scoth acu agus boladh iontach.

• Roosters (or cockerels) can usually be differentiated from hens by their striking plumage of long flowing tails and shiny, pointed feathers on their necks and backs.

• Roosters plumage or feathers are nearly always a brighter and bolder colour than the females of the same breed.

• Roosters crowing is a loud and sometimes shrill call and is a territorial signal to other roosters.

• Roosters also crow in response to sudden disturbances within their surroundings.

• Roosters crow at any time of the day not just in the morning.

• De ghnáth is féidir le coiliogh (nó sicín coiligh) a dhifreáil ó chearca trína cluimhreach suntasach d'eireabaill fhada atá ag sileadh agus cleití lonracha, pointeáilte ar a muineál agus a gcúl.

• Tá cluimhreach nó cleití coiligh beagnach i gcónaí mar dath níos gile agus níos láidre ná an baineann den phór céanna.

• Is glaoch ard agus uaireanta géar é glaoch na gcoileach agus is comhartha dúiche do choiligh eile é.

• Bíonn glaoch na gcoileach ann freisin mar fhreagra ar suaitheadh tobann laistigh dá dtimpeallacht.

• Bíonn na coiligh ag glao ag am ar bith den lá, ní hamháin ar maidin.

• Red foxes have a varied diet.  They will eat almost anything, including insects, worms, rabbits, young hares, rats and small birds, mice, frogs and even fruit.

• Foxes who live by the coast eat crabs and fish, and foxes who live in or visit towns and cities eat leftover food thrown away by Man, which they find in dustbins, waste tips and refuse centres.

• Foxes have a bad reputation because they raid hen houses and farmyards, stealing chickens and eggs.

• Foxed are omnivorous, just like chickens.  This means that they will eat both plants and other animals.
